newsitem.title: JAPAN: Key JGB futures bounce back to close a bit higher.
newsitem.headline: Key JGB futures bounce back to close a bit higher.

text.p: Key December Japanese government bond futures closed a little higher on Thursday, after their rebound to 122.55 indicated the firm support they can expect from investors' buying and speculation surrounding the buying.
But after having climbed a little higher, the December contract stalled and nested in a comfortable zone to wait for the general election on Sunday, dealers said.

Few market participants would be eager to initiate a venture in either direction before they see the results of the election, they said. The December contract closed at 122.74, up 0.12 from Wednesday. Volume was 34,778 contracts.
Various polls are pointing to a victory by the Liberal Democrats in the election, but many market players are still wary of the chances of the opposition Shinshinto winning.
Shinshinto is calling for a huge tax cut of about 18 trillion yen, which would boost the economy and government debt issues as well.
The market could lose ground if the Shinshinto forms a coalition government with other parties.
More unknown, is if and how the next government decides to pass a supplementary budget to stimulate the economy after the election.
